title: 2 Easy Ways to Change Your YouTube Channel Description

steps.title: Tap your profile photo in the YouTube mobile app.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo in the YouTube mobile app. Whether you're using an Android, iPhone, or iPad, you'll see your photo or initial at the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Tap View channel.
steps.content: Tap View channel . It's just below your name at the top of the screen. If you don't see this option, tap Your channel instead. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon.
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon. You'll see it under your current channel description.

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon next to "Description."
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon next to "Description." This opens your channel description for editing.

steps.title: Update your description and tap SAVE.
steps.content: Update your description and tap SAVE . Once you save your changed channel description, your channel's homepage will update instantly. You'll also find other settings to change on the Channel Settings page, including the channel name , handle, pronouns, and subscription privacy .

steps.title: Sign in to YouTube Studio.
steps.content: Sign in to YouTube Studio. Point your web browser to https://studio.youtube.com , then log in if prompted.

steps.title: Click Customization in the left panel.
steps.content: Click Customization in the left panel. You may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Click the Basic info tab.
steps.content: Click the Basic info tab. It's near the top of the main panel.

steps.title: Update your description.
steps.content: Update your description. Make changes to your current description, or create a new description from scratch. You can also change other details here, including your handle , pronouns, and contact info. To add links to your YouTube Channel, click +ADD LINK and type or paste a URL.

steps.title: Click PUBLISH to save your changes.
steps.content: Click PUBLISH to save your changes. Your new YouTube channel description will now appear on your channel's home page.
